page.title: 03SHEEP IN NEWTON
page.content: More and more{sheep}are appearing in local fields, river banks and churchyards as farmers take advantage of{Common Market}subsidies. A local Ministry of Agriculture spokesman said,"Sheep farming is becoming very profitable. The pig market is unpredictable and dairy farming is very costly." Mr. George Hoyles who farms with his father and brother at Newton and keeps 300 sheep said,"Dairy farmers have suffered because of milk quotas, so more sheep are being kept in the fens. I use a new type of electric fencing which enables me to move sheep more easily all around the farm." But Mr. Hoyles did warn that E.E.C. guaranteed prices for sheep might not last for ever. The current value of a good ewe is Â£50 to Â£60.
